decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 5 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [2038-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-1004 rev. P01; 2038-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-1005 rev. P01; 2038-BRL01-XX-DR-C-1006 rev. P01; 2038-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-1008 rev. P01; 2038-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-1100 rev. P01; 2038-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-1200 rev. P01; 2038-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-1300 rev. P01; 2038-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-1301 rev. P01]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - Details and samples of materials to be used on any external surface of the development including structures and hard landscaping materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the use of the materials within the development. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved materials.
Reason: In order to assess the suitability of the proposed materials, in the interests of the appearance of the locality, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 4 - Prior to their installation further details of the proposed security shutter, security gate and all handrails shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details with the handrails and enclosures maintained in good order over the lifetime of the development.
Reason: In order to assess the suitability of the proposed means of enclosure, in the interests of the appearance of the locality and personal safety and security, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 5 - Prior to commencement (including but not limited to any preparatory works) details shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority of a Construction Environmental Management Plan (CEMP) including (but not limited to): 
- details of any construction lighting to be used demonstrating, how it complies with Guidance Note 08/18 Bats and artificial lighting in the UK Bats and the Built Environment series ILP & BCT; 
- measures to prevent spills and contaminants entering the River Thames
- details of measures to reduce impacts of pile driving including (but not limited to) proposed low noise and press-piling techniques
- details of biosecurity measures
- details of measures to protect priority species including fish, wintering birds, bats, seals and otters
- detail of timing of works to avoid harm to wintering birds and migrating and breeding fish.
The development shall not be undertaken otherwise than in accordance with the approved CEMP. 
Reason: To ensure construction works and traffic impacts are minimised, to protect amenities of neighbouring occupiers and biodiversity and to mitigate the impacts of development on protected and priority species, in accordance with Core Strategy Policy IS4, and DMPD policies DMS1 and DMS3 and London Plan Policy G6. The details are required prior to the start of the works so that the necessary precautions and mitigation measures can be implemented prior to construction works commencing.

Condition : 6 - Prior to commencement of development an updated Biodiversity and Ecology Plan should be undertaken and the report submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The results of the survey should then inform any necessary additional mitigation, details of which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 
Reason: To mitigate the impacts of development on protected and priority species, in accordance with Core Strategy Policy IS4, and DMPD policies DMS1 and DMS3 and London Plan Policy G6. The details are required prior to the start of the works so that the necessary precautions and mitigation measures can be implemented prior to construction works commencing.

Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans and set out in the supporting information, an Ecological Enhancements Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of works. The Plan shall include details of all measures to provide biodiversity gain, including but not limited to: 
- details of habitat creation on and around the pontoon and bankseat piles and the low-level retaining wall, including but not limited to timber cladding on the structural pilings, provision of timbers along the length of the riverside face of the low-level retaining wall and other habitat enhancement features;
- measures to minimis the risk of the introduction and/or spread of invasive non-native species;
- details of a management plan to be implemented, which shall include management responsibilities and maintenance schedules for all the above-mentioned measures to provide biodiversity gain. 
Te approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the 
development and maintained thereafter.
Reason: To enhance the ecological interest of the site and to ensure that the ecological features are provided and maintained in a satisfactory manner in accordance with policy DMO4 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and London Plan Policy G6.

Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans and set out in the supporting information an updated Navigational Risk Assessment (NRA) informed following the undertaking of a visual assessment (live trials) of rowing operations through the arches of Putney Bridge during some race 
day events, shall be submitted to and approval in writing by the local planning authority, in consultation with the Port of London Authority (PLA), prior to commencement of the development. The development shall be carried out and operate in accordance with the approved details, with the 
implementation of any required mitigation measures confirmed prior to commencement of use of the pier. 
Reason: To ensure that the development does not have a detrimental impact on navigational safety for other river users and that any necessary mitigation measures are identified and undertaken, in accordance with policy DMO7 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 
2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
[Note: Further engagement is recommended with the PLA Harbour Master Team to determine the exact scope of the NRA and in particular to determine the effects on the use of arch 4 of Putney Bridge during the construction phase and permanent works including in connection with the boat race, 
and the effects on the use of arch 5 of Putney Bridge for recreational craft when there is available water as well as on how vessel movements would be managed between the existing Putney Pier and the proposed development]

Condition : 9 - Prior to commencement of development a full numerical hydrodynamic and scour assessment, to assess, and mitigate effectively, if necessary, the impact of scour from the development on the foreshore, including the adjacent Thames Tideway Tunnel installation, shall be submitted to and 
approved in writing by the local planning authority. The foreshore should be monitored for scour throughout the first 12 months of the development�s operation to ascertain whether any additional mitigation is required. Any required mitigation should be agreed with the Environment Agency and 
implemented as approved.
Reason: To protect the integrity of existing flood defences in accordance with policy DMS5 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 and the London Plan (2021).

Condition : 10 - The development hereby permitted shall not commence until a monitoring and maintenance plan to protect the foreshore, including a timetable of monitoring and submission of reports, has been submitted to, and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Reports as specified in the approved plan, including details of any necessary mitigation measures arising from the monitoring, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority. The plan should provide details of the type and frequency of monitoring. Bathymetric / topographical surveys should be 
undertaken every 6 months for 3 years, with this commencing just prior to construction and compared to a pre-existing baseline, minus the dredged area for the pontoon.
Reason: To ensure that the use of the development does not have a detrimental impact on the 
intertidal foreshore from wave wash, to protect the nature conservation value of the intertidal foreshore 
as well as ensure the foreshore continues to provide protection and stability to the Thames tidal flood defences, in accordance with Policies DMS5 and DMO6 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy 
Framework 2021.

Condition : 11 - The development permitted by this planning permission shall be carried out in accordance with the Flood Risk Assessment and SuDS Strategy by Beckett Rankine dated 27/05/2022.The mitigation measures identified in the report shall be implemented and retained as such.
Reason: To reduce the risk of flooding to the proposed development and future occupants and third parties and in the interests of managing surface water in accordance with policy DMS5 and DMS6 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the 
requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 12 - Full details of any external lighting to be erected within the application site both during the construction phase and all subsequent permanent external lighting, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before its installation, including clear geo-referenced lux contour plans and details of measures to prevent light spill onto any habitat creation within and immediately adjacent to the development site including details of how any lighting will be of a specification that minimises its impacts on bats and the River Thames, in accordance with the BCT and ILP 2018 Guidance, and 
including hours of operation of the proposed lighting.
Reason: In the interests of ecological functionality, the character and appearance of the historic building, and the amenities of future occupiers and users of the development, in accordance with Council policies DMS1; DM07 and DMO4 of the Development Management Policies Document 
(adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 13 - Prior to commencement of use Riparian Life Saving Equipment including, but not limited to, one lifebuoy and three ladders on the pier and grab holds around the perimeter of the pontoon, shall be provided and subsequently maintained in good order over the lifetime of the development.
Reason: In the interest of safety and security of users of the development in accordance with Council policies DMS1 and DM07 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 14 - No temporary or permanent works associated with the construction of the bankseat, 
fixed bridge or canting brow shown on drawing 2038-BRL-01-XX-DR-C-1008 rev. P01 shall take place until a construction method statement (detailing the location of plant and equipment to be used, the depth and type of piling to be undertaken, the methodology by which such piling will be carried out, measures to prevent and minimise the potential for damage to subsurface water infrastructure, and the programme for the works) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority in consultation with Bazalgette Tunnel Limited and Thames Water. All works must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved piling method statement.
Reason: To ensure the works do not adversely affect subsurface water infrastructure of national significance n accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 15 - Construction of the fixed bridge shall not commence until details of the landside. works have been submitted to and approved by the planning authority in consultation with Bazalgette Tunnel Limited and Thames Water. The information submitted shall demonstrate how the landscaping and balustrades proposed integrate with existing and shall include details of the connections proposed to the foreshore structure.
Reason: To ensure the new works are appropriately integrated with the existing structure , in the interests of the appearance of the locality and safety and security, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 16 - INFORMATIVE: The applicant is reminded that they require a River Works Licence issued by the PLA to carry out the proposed development, and that they should contact the PLA�s Statutory Consents and Compliance team at lic.app@pla.co.uk for further information regarding this.

Condition : 17 - INFORMATIVE: Access and use of Thames Water Utilities Ltd Land: The applicant is advised that the grant of planning permission does not give a right of connection to the new Thames Water Utilities Ltd (TWUL) owned foreshore. For this to occur a separate legal agreement will need to be entered into which would be subservient to the rights granted to Tideway.

Condition : 18 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description: Works in connection with the provision of a new river pier to serve a river bus service including two dolphin piles, a fixed bridge, canting brow, bankseat with shelter above and pontoon alongside landside works including the integration of the fixed bridge to the Thames Tideway Structure.
